Package controller

Class MainFormController

java.lang.Object
controller.MainFormController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainFormController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is used to manage the flow of data and view of the application's main GUI form.
Author:
David Long

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method loads the current form's GUI elements and sets the form's tableviews with customer and appointment data from the database.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location of the controller's .fxml file
      resourceBundle - The locale-specific resources for the controller's objects

    • onActionAddCustomer

      void onActionAddCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method moves the current scene to the Customer form.
      Parameters:
      event - customers "Add" button click
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown by FXMLLoader.load() if the .fxml file URL is not input correctly

    • onActionUpdateCustomer

      void onActionUpdateCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method identifies the selected customer, sets the customer modification tracking variable to "true", then moves the current scene to the Customer form.
      Parameters:
      event - customers "Update" button click
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown by FXMLLoader.load() if the .fxml file URL is not input correctly

    • onActionDeleteCustomer

      void onActionDeleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      This method identifies the selected customer from the customers tableview and performs a check for remaining appointments. If there are no appointments related to the customer, the customer is removed from the database upon user confirmation.
      Parameters:
      event - customers "Delete" button click
      Throws:
      SQLException - handles SQL errors

    • onActionAddAppt

      void onActionAddAppt(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method moves the current scene to the Appointment form.
      Parameters:
      event - appointments "Add" button click
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown by FXMLLoader.load() if the .fxml file URL is not input correctly

    • onActionUpdateAppt

      void onActionUpdateAppt(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method identifies the selected appointment, sets the appointment modification tracking variable to "true", then moves the current scene to the Appointment form.
      Parameters:
      event - appointments "Update" button click
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown by FXMLLoader.load() if the .fxml file URL is not input correctly

    • onActionDeleteAppt

      void onActionDeleteAppt(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      This method identifies the selected appointment from the appointments tableview and, upon user confirmation, removes the appointment from the database.
      Parameters:
      event - appointments "Delete" button click
      Throws:
      SQLException - handles SQL errors

    • onViewAllAppts

      void onViewAllAppts(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method sets the Appointments tableview with all the appointments currently in the database.
      Parameters:
      event - "All Appointments" radio button selected

    • onViewMonthAppts

      void onViewMonthAppts(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      This method sets the Appointments tableview with all the appointments currently in the database that fall within the current month.
      Parameters:
      event - "Current Month" radio button selected
      Throws:
      SQLException - handles SQL errors

    • onViewWeekAppts

      void onViewWeekAppts(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      This method sets the Appointments tableview with all the appointments currently in the database that fall within the current week.
      Parameters:
      event - "Current Week" radio button selected
      Throws:
      SQLException - handles SQL errors

    • onActionShowReports

      void onActionShowReports(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method moves the current scene to the Reports form.
      Parameters:
      event - "Reports" button click
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown by FXMLLoader.load() if the .fxml file URL is not input correctly

    • onActionLogOut

      void onActionLogOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Upon confirmation though use of a dialog box, this method changes the current scene to the Login GUI form and sets "currentUserID" object to null.
      Parameters:
      event - "Logout" button click
      Throws:
      IOException - thrown by FXMLLoader.load() if the .fxml file URL is not input correctly
